did.abstract: Collection of stereograph images of views of Michiganâ€™s Upper Peninsula in the late nineteenth century.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The provenance of the collection is uncertain.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Martha Mullett collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: There is no information available about Martha Mullett, the collector of these photographs.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of six envelopes of stereographs published by Bailey & Whitesides, C. B. Brubaker, and A. G. Emergy, and some photographed by B. F. Childs. The images are scenes of Michigan's Upper Peninsula in the late nineteenth century, including Michigamme, Houghton, Hancock, and Sault Sainte Marie, Michigan and the Pictured Rocks.

controlaccess.head: Contributors:
controlaccess.corpname: Bailey & Whitesides Stereoscopic and Portrait Gallery.

did.unittitle: Bailey & Whitesides Stereoscopic and Portrait Gallery, Marquette, Mich.
"Gems of Lake Superior Scenery" published by C.B. Brubaker, Marquette, Mich.
Michigamme, Mich., including Lake Michigamme, Michigamme Iron Mine, and Jacob Houghton party
"Lake Superior Views" published by A.C. Emery, Marquette, Mich.
Houghton and Hancock, Mich., including copper mines, stamp mills, smelters, and a hospital
"The Picturesque of Lake Superior" photographed by B.F. Childs, published by C.B. Brubaker, Marquette, Mich.
Marquette area, Mich., including Laughing Water Falls, camping, and iron mines; also Sault Ste. Marie, Mich., including Indian village
